sn55.18:1.2: And then Venerable Mahāmoggallāna, as easily as a strong person would extend or contract their arm, vanished from Jeta’s Grove and reappeared among the gods of the Thirty-Three.
sn55.18:1.3: Then several deities of the company of the Thirty-Three went up to Venerable Mahāmoggallāna, bowed, and stood to one side. Moggallāna said to them:
sn55.18:2.1: “Reverends, it’s good to have experiential confidence in the Buddha. …
sn55.18:2.3: It’s the reason why some sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
sn55.18:2.4: It’s good to have experiential confidence in the teaching. …
sn55.18:2.6: and to have the ethical conduct that’s loved by the noble ones … leading to immersion.
sn55.18:2.7: It’s the reason why some sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.”
sn55.18:3.1: “My good Moggallāna, it’s good to have experiential confidence in the Buddha …
sn55.18:3.3: It’s the reason why some sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
sn55.18:3.4: It’s good to have experiential confidence in the teaching. …
sn55.18:3.6: and to have the ethical conduct that’s loved by the noble ones … leading to immersion.
sn55.18:3.7: It’s the reason why some sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.”
